name: Clipick
description_brief: Climate data is a need for different types of modelling assessments. This tool provides an user-friendly interface to facilitate access to climate datasets, that are used to supply climate scenarios for the International Panel on Climate Change.
description_full:
Step 1 - Select the time span, time step, and variables format you whish to retrieve
Step 2 - Select the location by dragging the icon in the map
Step 3 - Click on Extract data. The Extraction will be queued and a link will be activated when the extraction is ready

Grid has about 25 km (AR4) and 9km (AR5) resolution, and climate in mountainous regions or coastal areas or with special geomorphology characteristics need to be used carefully

You can also use the API to extract the data programmatically
minimum_req: Desktop computer (e.g. optimized for wider screens)
Cross-platform tool (works in Windows, Mac and Linux)
indicators: provides climate at daily/monthly time step for the assessment of many of these indicators
spatial_scales: provides climate at daily/monthly time step for the assessment of many of these indicators
input_data_protocols: User enters the data directly manually
Data entry can be fully automated programmatically (e.g. automatically run a script for multiple scenarios)
input_data_formats: HTTP (query string parameters, data in request body & file uploads)
input_data_file_formats: HTTP GET method - Query string parameters (e.g. http://www.url.com/start?param1=a&param2=b)
output_data_formats: Widely used file formats (CSV, JSON, XML, etc.)
access_barrier: No, direct download/access through a web link
integrated_other_tools_list:
Works with YieldSAFE (python version) totally interoperable, e.g. the python code do HTTP request to clipick to retrieve climate data for simulations data

details on how to integrate: https://github.com/euraf/clipick
